entry.title: blockade of Biafra (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that at least one million civilians died as a result of the blockade of Biafra (child pictured)?

entry.title: St Monacella (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in a village in Wales, hares were traditionally nicknamed "St Monacella's lambs"?

entry.title: Yurie Funato (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Yurie Funato, a voice actress and former singer, was bullied in high school for her high-pitched voice?

entry.title: Fitzgerald Hoard (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Fitzgerald Hoard included sealed treasury bags of silver dollars, casino chips, and other casino related merchandise?

entry.title: Walter Fischer (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that former International Brigades doctor Walter Fischer managed the Austrian broadcasts of Radio Moscow during World War II?

entry.title: cast more than 500 million votes in one election (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in 1964, Illinoisans cast more than 500 million votes in one election?

entry.title: Mike Shenk (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Mike Shenk once constructed an entire crossword puzzle by hand in an hour?

entry.title: Foodbank Canterbury (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Foodbank Canterbury receives products from a prison?
